TITLE: Kevin McCarthy’s Speaker Drama Raises New Fears on Debt Limit
SUMMARY: An emboldened conservative flank and concessions made to win votes could lead to a protracted standoff on critical fiscal issues, risking economic pain.

TITLE: Jack Ma, Ant Group Founder, Will Relinquish Control
SUMMARY: Ant Group, the fintech sister company of the e-commerce behemoth Alibaba, is one of China’s most influential companies.

TITLE: A New Area of A.I. Booms, Even Amid the Tech Gloom
SUMMARY: An investment frenzy over “generative artificial intelligence” has gripped Silicon Valley, as tools that generate text, images and sounds in response to short prompts seize the imagination.

TITLE: ‘Alexa, Why Do We Keep Buying You?’
SUMMARY: With questions swirling about the utility of voice assistants, we asked readers how they use one of the most popular, Amazon’s Alexa. Here’s what they answered.

TITLE: Fed Officials Ask How to Better Understand Inflation After Surprises
SUMMARY: Federal Reserve officials, including Lisa Cook, a board member, are wrestling with how to think about price increases after 18 months of rapid change.

TITLE: The Hottest Gen Z Gadget Is a 20-Year-Old Digital Camera
SUMMARY: Young people are opting for point-and-shoots and blurry photos.

TITLE: Getting Rid of Remote Work Will Take More Than a Downturn
SUMMARY: As the economy slows, a handful of prominent C.E.O.s have tried to put an end to remote work. But some economists say that even in a cooler labor market, working from home is likely to remain common.

TITLE: Wells Fargo Executive Fired After Air India Urination Allegation
SUMMARY: The executive, for the Indian subsidiary of Wells Fargo, was fired after the investigation became public. Air India faces scrutiny for how it handled the matter.

TITLE: As Asian Societies Age, ‘Retirement’ Just Means More Work
SUMMARY: Across East Asia, populations are graying faster than anywhere else in the world, and while younger generations shrink, older workers are often toiling well into their 70s and beyond.

TITLE: The Engineers Are Bloggers Now
SUMMARY: In a perpetually tricky market for tech talent, large companies are turning to an in-house resource to get the word out.

TITLE: What Are Your Tech Resolutions for 2023?
SUMMARY: The Times wants to know how you plan to use technology differently this year.

TITLE: C-SPAN and Cable News Get a Boost From the House Speaker Vote
SUMMARY: C-SPAN, the low-fi cable network beloved by the Congressional cognoscenti, has gotten a major boost in attention for its coverage of the House floor, now the site of a political battle for the ages.

TITLE: Walgreens Executive Says Shoplifting Threat Was Overstated
SUMMARY: In a call with investors on Thursday, the chief financial officer of Walgreens, James Kehoe, said “maybe we cried too much last year” over theft.

TITLE: US Jobs Report: Employers Added 223,000 Jobs in December
SUMMARY: The Federal Reserve’s moves to cool the economy with higher interest rates seem to be taking gentle hold. Wage growth lost momentum.

SUMMARY: Traders are betting that a slowdown in job growth and wage gains could reduce the pressure on prices and make the Federal Reserve less aggressive in raising interest rates.

TITLE: As China Reopens Its Borders, Mixed Feelings at Home and Abroad
SUMMARY: Friends and families are planning reunions; tourists are booking flights. But amid the anticipation, there’s a whiff of anxiety.

SUMMARY: The tech giant had already remade the virtual world. For a brief period, it also tried to make it easier for people in the Bay Area to get to work. Then it gave up.

TITLE: Crime and Police TV Shows Like ‘Criminal Minds’ Are Big Streaming Hits
SUMMARY: Prestige shows like “The White Lotus” grab a lot of the headlines and rave reviews. But viewers still like to settle in with the familiar.

TITLE: ESPN Looks for the Right Tone as the NFL Resumes Games
SUMMARY: The broadcast on Saturday was a test of how the networks are going to cover the sport in the wake of Damar Hamlin’s collapse on the field last Monday.

SUMMARY: Sam Bankman-Fried, the disgraced cryptocurrency executive, pleads not guilty to an array of charges. A bumpy road ahead for Tesla. And the latest inflation figures are coming out.

TITLE: ‘M3gan’ Beats Box Office Predictions, Sailing Into Second Place
SUMMARY: The $12 million PG-13 horror film brought in $30.2 million in ticket sales, behind “Avatar: The Way of Water,” with $45 million.

TITLE: Yes, Your Job Is Important. But It’s Not All-Important.
SUMMARY: Here is how to think about the gulf between what you should do and what you can do.

SUMMARY: Many people who want to work can’t because of long-term health problems, a persistent issue that is causing Britain’s economy to go “into reverse.”

SUMMARY: Inspired by digital art generators like DALL-E, biologists are building artificial intelligences that can fight cancer, flu and Covid.

SUMMARY: The C.E.O., Robert A. Iger, said in a memo that he thought the move would benefit the company’s culture and creativity.

TITLE: French Food Giant Danone Sued Over Plastic Use Under Landmark Law
SUMMARY: Environmental groups are relying on a law in France requiring large companies to address their environmental footprint.

SUMMARY: Analysts have begun trimming their profit forecasts, with pronounced downgrades for growth at energy and financial firms.

SUMMARY: A rocket launched from a Virgin Orbit jumbo jet is expected to put satellites into orbit, a step for Britain into the space launch business.

SUMMARY: Earnings season kicks off this week, and analysts expect a big drop in corporate profits and more announcements about layoffs.

SUMMARY: More than 7,000 nurses at Mount Sinai Medical Center and Montefiore Medical Center are seeking better wages and working conditions.

SUMMARY: The reporter, Dion Rabouin, who is Black, was handcuffed and placed in a police vehicle after conducting interviews outside a bank in November.

SUMMARY: He covered wars, revolutions and diplomatic breakthroughs for CBS, NBC and The New York Times. He also served, briefly and unhappily, as a State Department spokesman.

SUMMARY: Proposed changes to federal student-loan repayment plans tied to income could cut some borrowers’ monthly payments by more than half.

SUMMARY: The Florida governor easily won re-election despite little engagement with mainstream news outlets, another sign of partisan division ahead of the 2024 presidential race.

SUMMARY: Trillions of dollars in government spending will profoundly affect the labor market, but in ways hard to measure, and mostly under the surface.

SUMMARY: Sexually explicit content has become so prevalent online that teenagers are deluged, according to a new report by a nonprofit child advocacy group.

SUMMARY: The Securities and Exchange Commission fined Steve Easterbrook for lack of disclosure about the circumstances behind his firing in 2019.

SUMMARY: The cuts at the cryptocurrency exchange come after nearly a fifth of employees were let go in June, as crypto markets teeter and tech companies rethink their growth plans.

SUMMARY: Many people who want to work can’t because of long-term health problems, a persistent issue that is causing Britain’s economy to go “into reverse.”

SUMMARY: The investment bank plans to cut up to 3,200 jobs, or roughly 6 percent of its work force, as it faces economic challenges and cuts costs after an expensive foray into consumer lending.

SUMMARY: President Emmanuel Macron is focusing on cutting costs in France’s pension system, but labor unions, which fiercely oppose the measure, have promised a showdown.

SUMMARY: The company grappled with missteps for years while developing a microprocessor code-named Sapphire Rapids. It comes out on Tuesday.

SUMMARY: In a speech on Federal Reserve independence, Chair Jerome H. Powell emphasized that climate change should be addressed by elected officials.

SUMMARY: When a Virgin Orbit rocket fell short of orbit, it dealt a blow to Britain’s space program and the companies whose satellites were lost in the mission.

SUMMARY: An “anomaly” prevented a rocket from reaching orbit after its release from a jumbo jet, Virgin Orbit said.

The F.A.A. was investigating the cause of the outage that delayed or canceled flights nationwide, but there was no evidence of a cyberattack, the Biden administration said.

SUMMARY: The company has discussed selling some user names through online auctions, people with knowledge of the plans said.

SUMMARY: If Congress fails to increase the government’s borrowing limit in time, the result would be a shock to the economy and financial markets.

SUMMARY: In a speech on Federal Reserve independence, Chair Jerome H. Powell emphasized that climate change should be addressed by elected officials.

SUMMARY: OpenAI’s new chat bot is raising fears of cheating on homework, but its potential as an educational tool outweighs its risks.

SUMMARY: The disgraced founder of the crypto exchange FTX denied that he stole anyone’s money and said customers could still get their deposits back.

SUMMARY: With the economy in a fragile state, Chinese officials are starting to use more business-friendly language, and also to back their words with action.

SUMMARY: More than 110 miles above earth, the rocket’s second-stage engine prematurely shut down before entering orbit, causing the loss of nine satellites.

SUMMARY: Borrowing remained elevated last year as spending fights loom in a divided Congress.

SUMMARY: Southwest Airlines’ chief executive, Bob Jordan, said frigid temperatures and mistakes by the company caused its meltdown around Christmas.

SUMMARY: The country’s largest lenders increased their reserves to protect against deteriorating economic conditions this year, after reporting resilient profits for the end of last year.

SUMMARY: The price reductions in the United States will make more of the company’s electric vehicles eligible for a federal tax credit.

SUMMARY: We asked nearly 400 people to tell us how much they earn. Here are two dozen who actually spoke to us.

SUMMARY: The merits of talking candidly about salary are widely acknowledged. Actually doing it is more complicated.

SUMMARY: Signs of slowing inflation are competing with downbeat company forecasts as earnings season begins.

SUMMARY: Cut back on stock and bond holdings, and focus on money market funds, C.D.s, Treasury bills and other options that are now offering high yields, our columnist says.

SUMMARY: He helped turn Guggenheim Partners into a global investing giant. He was also a CNBC and Bloomberg commentator and a philanthropist for human rights.

SUMMARY: Kristalina Georgieva, the managing director of the International Monetary Fund, predicts that a global recession can be avoided.

SUMMARY: The disgraced founder of the crypto exchange FTX denied that he stole anyone’s money and said customers could still get their deposits back.

SUMMARY: The entertainment genre of historical drama is flourishing — and riddled with inaccuracies. The untrue parts are leading to more public spats and lawsuits.

SUMMARY: The Treasury Department expects to begin taking “extraordinary measures” to continue paying the government’s obligations before what is expected to be a big fight to raise the borrowing cap.

SUMMARY: Tips from psychologists, managers and people who have successfully asked what can feel like a very difficult question.

SUMMARY: Reforms embedded in the Inflation Reduction Act will bring savings to seniors this year. Already some lawmakers are aiming to repeal the changes.

SUMMARY: After the Abraham Accords, partnerships between companies in Israel and Arab countries have led to the kinds of initiatives that will be on the Davos agenda.

SUMMARY: In three Broadway plays this season, a quest for financial stability can’t undo the trauma of the past or dismantle the architecture that places a ceiling on Black futures.

SUMMARY: Differences on NATO and E.U. enlargement, energy and climate, and relationships with the United States, China, Russia and Ukraine will prime Davos talks.

SUMMARY: The Covid-19 pandemic, invasion of Ukraine, trend toward autocracy and economic inequalities challenge the World Economic Forum’s relevance.

SUMMARY: Almost a year after Russia launched its invasion, assessing the impact on the oil industry and greenhouse gas goals is not so simple.

SUMMARY: David Miliband, head of the International Rescue Committee, says the global refugee crisis “is manageable, not insoluble.”

SUMMARY: An uptick hinted at in surveillance data was a mirage, the officials said.

SUMMARY: Signs of slowing inflation are competing with downbeat company forecasts as earnings season begins.
